SENT.plain: We performed MR (magnetic resonance) brain imaging on 24 patients with a systemic vasculitis
MRI proved to be a sensitive method for detecting brain lesions (clinically silent or manifest) in these patients
The most frequent abnormalities were periventricular lesions seen in 12 cases
Such changes are not specific for vascular disease, and are often seen in multiple sclerosis
However, additional changes were commonly seen which suggested the correct diagnosis
